alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Des Moines; Jackson; Lee; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 10:09AM CST until January 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Northwest winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Illinois, east central and southeast Iowa and northeast Missouri. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 AM to noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact this evening and Friday morning commutes. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional headlines for wind chills may be needed Friday night into the weekend.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Clinton; Des Moines; Jackson; Lee; Scott
